column4: Hello! im very new to Ubuntu, i want to connect my external HFS drive to my computer, but it dosent work. I read about kernels that maybe my kernel dosent support HFS filesystem. How do i check that?
what kernel are you using
!hsf+
!hsf
I thought hsf+ was recognized by default...
i can see my drivers, but not mount them..
what version of ubuntu are you using?
ohh, its xubuntu..
ah, I'm not sure that xubuntu has an automounting tool like in gnome
you might have to edit your fstab
its so irritating.. because its my sons problem.. he want to connect this drive to his ps3
he installed this "custom" kernel so he can use wifi.
I'd ask in #xubuntu I'm not very familiar with xubuntu's user space tools. If the kernel is customized, he may not have the drivers in it.
ok. but is it possible to install ubuntu over xubuntu?
Yes, it's possible to install normal ubuntu through synaptic
without ereasing the kernel?
yes, kernels are a separate issue to user tools
gnome / xfce / kde are userspace
nothing to do with the kernel
ok! i try that. thanks everybody! Hope i dont need to get here again. ;)
